metadata.Title: CVE-2018-9989 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
ARM mbed TLS before 2.1.11, before 2.7.2, and before 2.8.0 has a buffer over-read in ssl_parse_server_psk_hint() that could cause a crash on invalid input.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-9989` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmbedcrypto1 - 2.8.0-1
libmbedtls10 - 2.8.0-1
libmbedx509-0 - 2.8.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mbedtls package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.8.0-1').
